Logistic

Venue

The course is hosted by University of California, Santa Barbara - Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology and the venue is on Campus at Humanities and Social Sciences Building (HSSB) (you can locate the building at D/2 of the campus map ).
The course will from 8.30am until 5.00pm with 1 or 1.30 hour brake for lunch.

Accommodation

Beside the typical www.booking.com or www.airbnb.com you can rent also a Campus Apartment at http://www.conferences.ucsb.edu/apartment-rental filling Online Reservation Request Form . There is a section where you can enter the names of the participants sharing the apartment. If they have availability, a team member from their office will send a separate payment link to the reserver to pay online with a credit card. All occupants of the apartment can then split the cost amongst themselves.
When you fill in the form use the name of the workshop: Spatio-Temporal Data Analysis. After completing the reservation request, you need summit electronically to conferences@housing.ucsb.edu the letter of invitation from the EEMB-UCSB department.
Another good alternative is http://www.summerinnsantabarbara.com/

Travel Info


The easiest way to reach Santa Barbara is to fly to Santa Barbara Airport or Los Angeles Airport. From Los Angeles Airport you can use http://www.sbairbus.com/ which stop in Goleta and in Santa Barbara.

Parking Info

  1. Anyone staying in Santa Ynez apartments will have free parking there and it's walking distance to campus.
  2. Parking in the student village of Isla Vista. IV is about a 5-10 minute walk from our building. It borders the west side of campus and should have plenty of free street parking. Respect any “no parking” signal or street sweeping signs since cops are very strict in IV.
  3. Take the bus or carpool.
  4. Buy a daily or weekly permit on campus wherever you park. Closest lot/garage is 22 and 27 (E2 on the map).
  5. Buy a daily or weekly permit online at: http://www.tps.ucsb.edu/

Travel Forum

In this section the course participants can post their journey itinerary or other kind of informations (e.g. willing to share a room in a hotel) and be able to travel together. Remember to write your e-mail address also in real-name box in order to show who wrote the post.
